files.description: Project configuration defining build system, dependencies, console entrypoint, and tooling metadata for the psyprim CLI.
User-facing documentation describing the mission, CLI commands, example workflows, and how to generate the validation/adoption roadmap outputs.
Package initializer exposing version and top-level interfaces for the psyprim toolkit.
Complete CLI implementation that generates a rigorous validation and adoption roadmap with selectable study designs, metrics, sampling frames, and analysis plans.
Pydantic models and JSON Schema export utilities for roadmap specifications, including experiments, metrics, sampling frames, and data collection/analysis methods.
Core logic to assemble empirically grounded roadmap plans, including default templates for surveys, audit studies, and adoption experiments tailored to psychology scholarship.
Definitions and computation scaffolds for citation accuracy, reproducibility, and usability metrics with operationalizations suitable for evaluation studies.
Sampling-frame builders for journals, archives, and researcher populations with stratification options and reproducible selection procedures.
Analysis-plan generator specifying statistical models, power/MDES heuristics, qualitative coding approaches, and reporting templates for adoption-effect estimation.
Input/output utilities to read optional user overrides and export roadmap artifacts as JSON, YAML, and Markdown reports with deterministic formatting.

missionDescription: Design a rigorous validation and adoption roadmap for the standardized workflows and lightweight tooling for primary-source scholarship in psychology. Produce an empirically grounded plan that specifies experimental designs (surveys, audit studies), metrics for citation accuracy/reproducibility/usability, sampling frames (journals, archives, researcher populations), and data collection/analysis methods to test the effect of tool adoption.
missionSuccessCriteria: Operationalized metrics: Provide clear, measurable definitions for citation accuracy, reproducibility of historical claims, and ease-of-research (e.g., error rates in citations, percent of verifiable claims, Likert usability scores) with thresholds for meaningful change.

Study designs: Deliver 2 complementary empirical protocols (a survey-based adoption study and an audit/experimental study across at least 3 journals and 3 archives) with sample size targets, randomization or matching strategy, and pre-registered hypotheses.

Data & tooling integration plan: Specify data collection instruments, metadata fields to capture (edition/translation provenance, variant page/paragraph numbers, repository citations), and how the lightweight plugins will log/interoperate with repositories and citation managers for automated measurement.

Analysis & decision rules: Provide statistical analysis plans (primary outcomes, effect sizes to detect, significance thresholds, handling of multiple comparisons), and clear criteria for declaring the protocol/toolset successful and ready for community endorsement.
